p: In animal models, CDV was administered utilizing topical and intrastromal inoculation three times per day for 20 consecutive days; the results displayed significant effectivity against HAdV type 5 when compared to the placebo group, reducing both viral shedding and the severity of sub-epithelial infiltrates. This study showed great promise in the future of cidofovir for the treatment of ocular HAdV infections in the future. 48 Additionally, early systemic administration of CDV in immunocompetent patients with HAdV pneumonia was an effective treatment strategy. 42 Due to the positive results in the aforementioned studies, CDV was tested as a prophylactic measure due to the epidemic nature of HAdV. Romanowski et al determined that antiviral prophylaxis with 1% and 0.5% concentrations of CDV significantly reduced viral replication of HAdV type 5 in animal models, giving promise to the use of CDV in prophylaxis. 49
